extendedIngredients.name: celery
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pounds celery roots (celeriac), peeled, woody parts trimmed and discarded, cut into 1/2-inch cubes (about 5 1/2 cups)
extendedIngredients.originalName: celery roots (celeriac), peeled, woody parts trimmed and discarded, cut into 1/2-inch cubes (about 5 1/2 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: russet potato
extendedIngredients.original: 1 10-ounce russet potato, peeled, cut into 1-inch pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: russet potato, peeled, cut into 1-inch pieces

title: Celery Root Bisque with Thyme Croutons
summary: Celery Root Bisque with Thyme Croutons might be just the soup you are searching for. Watching your figure? This gluten free and vegetarian recipe has 150 calories, 5g of protein, and 10g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 8 and costs $1.15 per serving. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. A mixture of shallots, thyme, additional thyme, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 31%. This score is not so awesome. Try Celery Root Bisque, Celery-Root Bisque with Shiitakes, and Smoked Salmon and Celery Root Bisque for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Melt butter in heavy large pot over medium heat. Add celery; cover and cook until slightly softened, about 3 minutes. Add shallots; sauté uncovered 3 minutes. Stir in celery root cubes and potato, then broth and 1 1/2 teaspoons thyme. Increase heat to high; bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until vegetables are very tender, about 40 minutes. Cool slightly.                                                                Working in batches, transfer soup to blender and puree until smooth. (Can be prepared 2 days ahead. Cool slightly. Cover and refrigerate.)                                                                Stir cream into soup and bring to simmer. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Ladle soup into bowls. Sprinkle with additional chopped thyme and serve.

steps.step: Melt butter in heavy large pot over medium heat.
Add celery; cover and cook until slightly softened, about 3 minutes.

Add shallots; sauté uncovered 3 minutes. Stir in celery root cubes and potato, then broth and 1 1/2 teaspoons thyme. Increase heat to high; bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until vegetables are very tender, about 40 minutes. Cool slightly.
Working in batches, transfer soup to blender and puree until smooth. (Can be prepared 2 days ahead. Cool slightly. Cover and refrigerate.)
Stir cream into soup and bring to simmer. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Ladle soup into bowls.
Sprinkle with additional chopped thyme and serve.
